rationale: No direct match found in the target schema for the donor ID.
Both fields refer to a unique identifier for the parent sample used in the assay.
No direct match found for datetime type with format constraint.
Both fields refer to the DOI for protocols, but they might involve different levels of detail.
No equivalent operator name found in the target schema.
No operator email found in the target schema.
No matching field for principal investigator.
No corresponding email for principal investigator in the target schema.
No match for assay category.
Both fields refer to the specific type of assay being executed or dataset type being produced.
Both fields refer to the class of analyte being measured.
Both fields refer to whether specific molecules are targeted for measurement.
Both refer to the vendor of the acquisition instrument.
Both refer to the model of the acquisition instrument.
No direct match found for single-cell isolation protocol DOI.
Both refer to the biological entity from which the analyte is derived.
No direct match found for tissue dissociation method.
No direct match found for enrichment method.
No direct match for isolation quality metric.
Both fields refer to the number of cells or nuclei input to the assay.
Both fields refer to the input quantity, though one is about cell count, the other analyte quantity.
No direct match found for the RNA sequencing method.
No corresponding field for the library construction protocol DOI.
Both fields refer to the library layout (single-end/paired-end).
Both fields refer to the adapter sequence used for the library.
No direct match for library ID found.
Both fields refer to whether the sequencing was performed in technical replicate.
Both fields refer to the read file containing the cell barcode.
Both fields refer to the position of the barcode in the read.
Both fields refer to the size of the cell barcode in base pairs.
The source refers to PCR cycles for amplification, while the target refers to iterations of cDNA amplification.
Both refer to the number of PCR cycles performed for indexing.
Both refer to the final yield of the library post-PCR.
Both fields refer to the units of the final library yield.
Both refer to the average fragment size of the sequencing library.
Both fields refer to the reagent kit used for sequencing.
Both refer to the number of sequencing cycles in each round of sequencing.
No matching field found for the percentage of Q30 reads.
No match found for percentage of PhiX reads.
Both fields refer to the path for the file with ORCID IDs of contributors.
Both fields refer to the path to the raw data file or directory.
